discoveryWsn

public void discoveryWsn()
Commands the SPINEManager to discovery the surrounding WSN nodes A default timeout of 2s, is used

discoveryWsn

public void discoveryWsn(long discoveryTimeout)
Commands the SPINEManager to discovery the surrounding WSN nodes This method sets the timeout for the discovery procedure. A timeout <= 0 will disable the Discovery Timer; this way a 'discovery complete' event will never be signaled and at any time an announcing node is added to the active-nodes list and signaled to the SPINE listeners.

Parameters:
discoveryTimeout - the timeout for the discovery procedure

setup

public void setup(Node node,
                  SpineSetupSensor setupSensor)
Setups a specific sensor of the given node. Currently, a sensor is setup by providing a sampling time value and a time scale factor

Parameters:
node - the destination of the request
setupSensor - the object containing the setup parameters

serviceCommand

public void serviceCommand(SpineServiceCommand serviceCommand)

setup

public void setup(Node node,
                  SpineSetupFunction setupFunction)
Setups a specific function of the given node. The parameters involved are 'function dependent' and are specified by providing a proper SpineSetupFunction instantiation object

Parameters:
node - the destination of the request
setupFunction - the object containing the setup parameters

activate

public void activate(Node node,
                     SpineFunctionReq functionReq)
Activates a function (or even only function sub-routines) on the given sensor. The content of the actual request is 'function dependent' and it's embedded into the 'SpineFunctionReq' instantiations.

Parameters:
node - the destination of the request
functionReq - the specific function activation request

deactivate

public void deactivate(Node node,
                       SpineFunctionReq functionReq)
Deactivates a function (or even only function sub-routines) on the given sensor. The content of the actual request is 'function dependent' and it's embedded into the 'SpineFunctionReq' instantiations.

Parameters:
node - the destination of the request
functionReq - the specific function deactivation request

getOneShotData

public void getOneShotData(Node node,
                           byte sensorCode)
Commands the given node to do a 'immediate one-shot' sampling on the given sensor. The method won't have any effects if the node is not provided with the given sensor.

Parameters:
node - the destination of the request
sensorCode - the sensor to be sampled
See Also:
SPINESensorConstants

startWsn

public void startWsn(boolean radioAlwaysOn)
Starts the WSN sensing and computing the previously requested functions. This is done thru a broadcast SPINE Synchr message. This simple start method will let the nodes use their default radio access scheme.

Parameters:
radioAlwaysOn - low-power radio mode control flag; set it 'true' to disable the radio low-power mode; 'false' to allow radio module turn off during 'idle' periods

startWsn

public void startWsn(boolean radioAlwaysOn,
                     boolean enableTDMA)
Starts the WSN sensing and computing the previously requested functions. This is done thru a broadcast SPINE Synchr message.

Parameters:
radioAlwaysOn - low-power radio mode control flag; set it 'true' to disable the radio low-power mode; 'false' to allow radio module turn off during 'idle' periods
enableTDMA - TDMA transmission scheme control flag; set it 'true' to enable the TDMA on the nodes; 'false' to keep using the default radio access scheme.

syncWsn

public void syncWsn()
Commands a software 'on node local clock' synchronization of the whole WSN. This is done thru a broadcast SPINE Synchr message.

resetWsn

public void resetWsn()
Commands a software reset of the whole WSN. This is done thru a broadcast SPINE Reset message.

getNodeByPhysicalID

public Node getNodeByPhysicalID(Address id)
Returns the already discovered Node corresponding to the given Address

Parameters:
id - the physical address of the Node to obtain
Returns:
the already discovered Node corresponding to the given Address or null if doesn't exist any Node with the given Address.

the already discovered Node corresponding to the given Address or null if doesn't exist any Node with the given Address.
